intro: Rhipidoglossum pulchellum var. pulchellum, commonly known as the white-flowered rock orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. The plant features a short, upright stem with a single, lance-shaped leaf that is often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, white, and arranged in a dense spike, producing a delicate, orchid-like appearance. It is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its specialized pollination mechanisms adapted to its alpine habitat.
